ARISTOCRATIC.Definition: relating to rich and powerful people, often of noble birth

OUT OF TOUCH.Definition: not aware of or familiar with current ideas or situations

BREATH.Definition: air that goes into and out of the lungs

FATE.Definition: what happens to a person, often beyond their control

VILLAINS.Definition: characters in stories who are evil or wicked

SPOILER.Definition: information that gives away the ending of a story or event

UPBRINGING.Definition: the way she was raised and taught as a child

GODPARENTS.Definition: couple who witnessed her baptism and had a special role in her life

EXCEPTION.Definition: a case that didn't follow the usual rule

RECONCILIATION.Definition: an act of making peace or restoring friendly relations

FORMALLY.Definition: in a proper or official manner

PROXY.Definition: substitute or stand-in for someone else

RITUAL.Definition: formal or ceremonial act or procedure

HEIR.Definition: a person who inherits or has the right to receive the position

OUTSIDER.Definition: someone who was not part of a particular group or community

ALLIANCE.Definition: close association between countries for mutual benefit

INFLUENCE.Definition: the ability to have an effect on someone or something

VISIBLE.Definition: able to be seen or noticed

ALLY.Definition: a country that supported and helped them

SUITABLE.Definition: appropriate or fitting for a particular purpose

FREE REIGN.Definition: freedom to do whatever she wished

DECORATE.Definition: adorn or add beauty to it by adding objects

SAW FIT.Definition: decided it was appropriate or fitting

LACK.Definition: the fact that there wasn't any

INTIMATE.Definition: relating to private or personal things

CONSUMMATED.Definition: made complete by having sexual relations

SUSPICION.Definition: a feeling of doubt or mistrust

PROFLIGATE.Definition: irresponsible or wasteful in the use of resources

EXTRAVAGANT.Definition: excessive, lavish, or spending too much money

GAMBLE.Definition: play games of chance for money

SALONS.Definition: social gatherings where people discussed art, literature, and other topics

DECKED OUT.Definition: decorated or adorned, often in a fancy or elaborate way

UNFOUNDED.Definition: not based on valid reasons or evidence

PERCEPTION.Definition: the way she was viewed or understood by people

RELIEF.Definition: feeling of comfort or reassurance after a difficult situation

FLEETING.Definition: lasting for a very short time

PORTRAYED.Definition: depicted or described in a particular way

UNSYMPATHETIC.Definition: lacking compassion or understanding towards others' feelings

DEVIANCE.Definition: behaviour that departs from the usual or accepted standards

MAKING A MOCKERY OF.Definition: ridiculing or treating with contempt or disrespect

SECLUDED.Definition: isolated or hidden away from others

RENEGING ON.Definition: failing to fulfil a promise or commitment

SCANDAL.Definition: event or action that caused public shock and anger

VILIFY.Definition: speak about her in an abusive or harmful way

IN PART.Definition: to some extent, but not entirely

INDECISIVE.Definition: unable to make decisions quickly or with confidence

DEFICIT.Definition: shortage or lack of money or resources

VASTLY.Definition: to a great extent or degree

TUBERCULOSIS.Definition: an infection that affects the lungs

UTTERLY.Definition: completely or to the fullest extent

HOUSE ARREST.Definition: the state of being kept as prisoners in their own house

CONDENSE.Definition: make it shorter or more concise

EXECUTED.Definition: put to death as a punishment

GUILLOTINE.Definition: a machine for cutting off people's heads, often used for executions

TURN TO.Definition: ask for help or seek support from

DEEPLY.Definition: very much or to a great extent

PROSPECTS.Definition: possibilities or chances for future success or well-being

TRIED.Definition: put on trial in a court of law

TRIBUNAL.Definition: special court or legal body for making judgements

DEPLETION.Definition: the act of using up or reducing

GILDED.Definition: covered with a layer of gold

JEERING.Definition: mocking or making fun of her in a disrespectful way

SCAFFOLD.Definition: a raised platform used for executions, such as hangings or beheadings

GUILLOTINED.Definition: put to death by beheading using a guillotine

SCHEMING.Definition: making secret plans deceitfully or dishonestly

EXAGGERATION.Definition: statement that makes her seem better than she really was

PAWN.Definition: person used by others for their own purposes without their knowledge or consent

A DEN OF SNAKES.Definition: a place full of deceitful or treacherous people

BRING HER DOWN.Definition: undermine or damage her reputation or position

MATURITY.Definition: the state of being fully developed, both mentally and emotionally

CHARITABLE.Definition: willing to help others by giving money, goods, or assistance

PATRON.Definition: a person who provided support or financial aid to artists

FAME.Definition: being widely recognised or renowned for something
